financialFormulas.name: Debt-to-Equity Ratio
financialFormulas.description: Measures the financial leverage of a company.

financialFormulas.name: Current Ratio
financialFormulas.description: Measures a company's ability to pay short-term obligations (due within one year).

riskFactors.name: Interest Rate Risk
riskFactors.description: The risk that changes in interest rates will adversely affect a company's financials or the value of a financial instrument.

riskFactors.name: Market Risk
riskFactors.description: The risk of losses in positions arising from movements in market prices.

analyticalTechniques.name: SWOT Analysis
analyticalTechniques.description: A strategic planning technique used to help an organization identify strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats related to business competition or project planning.

macroeconomicIndicators.name: GDP Growth Rate
macroeconomicIndicators.description: The rate at which a country's Gross Domestic Product is growing.

regulatoryGuidelines.name: Basel III Liquidity Coverage Ratio
regulatoryGuidelines.description: Requires banks to hold a buffer of high-quality liquid assets sufficient to deal with the cash outflows it could encounter over a 30-day stress period.
